content.question: A student is asked to determine the cross-sectional area of a thin wire of resistivity <math alttext="rho" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>ρ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The student determines the resistance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of various lengths <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the wire, graphs <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to obtain a straight line, and calculates the slope of the line as <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is equal to the area of the wire?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
